Posts.Content: mywifeconnie wrote: Connies marker number was 1470 when she was first diagnosed beginning of August, now it is 176 and still having chemo once a week. What do these numbers mean? I know that0-30 is where you need to be will these numbers go back up once she is done with chemo and on hormone therapy? She is very positive and takes the smallest positive news and makes it big. She has hope and courage and is back in the classroom teaching. I guess what to expect from here on out? Chemotherapy 2/18/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel), Xeloda (capecitabine) Dx 8/2/2013, Stage IV, mets, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Marker numbers and what this all means mywifeconnie Iwillwinthisbattle
